entry.title: The two of us under the same sky
entry.summary:
Author: Idachen

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,972Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 23

Summary: It’s been three and a half years since Eddie packed up his things and left Buck alone in California. 1242 Days that Buck lived on pause a part of him still praying for Eddie to come back. Until one night his phone rings with awful news: Eddie was in an accident and is in the hospital now, as the only legal guardian of Chris Buck has to drive to Texas and face Eddie and all these past years he spent in a fog of grief and anger.

entry.title: The downfall of the Gros Michel Banana
entry.summary:
Author: Emgiehae

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,208Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 51

Summary: Buck seems happy today. Really happy. And anyone that isn’t Eddie loves seeing him like this; but he knows Buck like he knows the back of his hand– he knows that this type of high usually comes with a low. As it so happens, Eddie knows exactly why Buck seems so happy, and why Buck's inevitably going to crash: The Buckley Parents are currently in the state of California. Maddie told Buck yesterday, announced that they’re going to have dinner, all of them– Buck went straight to Eddie’s after that. So. Yeah. Buck seems overjoyed, but Eddie knows that Buck is actively doing everything he can to not think about his parents, to not have one quiet moment alone in his brain. Everything meaning everything. Cleaning, hanging out with Chris, watching documentaries, and falling into research pits about the Gros Michel Banana and their impact on the banana flavour. Or: The Buckley parents are in town and the family secret is about to be spilled. Buck's mental health is impacted more than he lets on and the 118 are there to support him through an ADHD diagnosis he wasn't planning on getting.

entry.title: triage (and other things that hurt)
entry.summary:
Author: koleey

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,220Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 2

Summary: “Ma’am,” Eddie said, crouching low. “Can you hear me?” She looked up, blinking fast through the smoke. Late 30s, maybe early 40s, long dark hair and a torn blouse. “Yeah,” she rasped. “I—God, I think I bruised my ribs.” Eddie nodded, already checking her pupils and vitals. “Can you breathe okay? Any sharp pain when you inhale?” She coughed again, but shook her head. “No… no sharp pain. You’re cute, by the way.” Eddie froze.

entry.title: What If The Way You Hold Me (Is Actually What’s Holy)
entry.summary:
Author: Thasminsno1fan

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,662Chapters: 4/8Kudos: 5

Summary: Of course, the way Buck proposed to Tommy wasn’t perfect. There was no ring, no one knee, nothing ideal like that. But he did it for all the right reasons, yeah? The timing was a bit off but it would’ve happened anyway. It didn’t really have anything to do with Eddie, or his so called “feelings” for him. No. Absolutely not.But then a few weeks go by, and he’s still not over-the-moon excited in the same way Maddie was the weeks leading up to her wedding.The whole thing is a bit rushed, isn’t it?But Buck is set with going through with it. Surely when his, say, bachelor party comes around he’ll be excited. (And he will be, just maybe not for the right reason…)

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 146,144Chapters: 22/?Kudos: 43

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 130,075Chapters: 22/?Kudos: 15

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 119,727Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 15

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Between Heaven and Hell: Buck’s Desire
entry.summary:
Author: caarmeeem

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,570Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 14

Summary: Evan Buckley was never supposed to be born only as a “savior baby.” What no one knew was that, in their desperation to save Daniel, Phillip and Margaret turned to Lucifer Morningstar. A pact was sealed, but the debt was never paid.Now, years later, Buck carries not only the pain of failing to save his brother, but also the inheritance of a father who doesn’t belong to this world. Raised by Lucifer himself, Buck grows up among angels, demons, and humans, bearing the gift of hearing people’s deepest desires.By his sister Maddie’s side—the only part of the Buckley family who truly loves him—he finds the strength to keep following his own path.When he chooses to become a firefighter, fate intertwines him with Eddie Díaz—a deconstructed Catholic, single father, and the only person capable of making Buck believe that love can be greater than any dark legacy.

entry.summary:
Author: LLeopp

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,030Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 126

Summary: Athena, May, and Harry step forward, and Buck follows behind them eagerly, but the nurse stops him.“Just family for now, sorry.”Oh.Just family.Which he is not. Not really. Even if he thinks he is. Even if he pretends. Even if they all let him pretend.~~~When Buck isn't allowed to see bobby at the hospital, he stresses about not having any "real" family. Eddie's obvious and completely normal answer to this is to get married have Buck adopt his son. Chris's abandonment issues and Eddie's ptsd thrown in for extra fun.

entry.title: The Call That Never Ends
entry.summary:
Author: Morgana_TheWolf

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,467Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 65

Summary: It starts on the road to El Paso. Eddie calls Buck because the silence is too heavy, and Buck answers because of course he does. They don’t hang up. Not when Eddie reaches his mom’s house, not when Buck reads Jee a bedtime story, not when Eddie folds laundry or when Buck sings off-key in the shower. Two weeks later, their phones show 381 hours, 12 minutes on a single call. Professionally? It helps them focus. Socially? Nobody calls anymore, so they just text other people. Emotionally? The other’s voice is enough to keep them alive. By the time Chris decides he wants to go home, the only question left is: when do you hang up, if you never wanted to let go in the first place?

entry.title: I don't know why everything's changed
entry.summary:
Author: Az11uu

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,734Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 37

Summary: Eddie slowly turned his head toward Buck. His voice came out low, barely a whisper, full of disbelief. “We didn’t talk for months… But you still came. Why?” Buck looked at him for a long second. There were so many ways to answer, but only one was true. “If you need me, you can call me,” he said with calm firmness. “And I’ll be there.” His voice didn’t shake. Not anymore. “I’ll be the friend you need,” he added. “Or whatever you need me to be.”   ------ After the lightning and the coma, Eddie started pulling away from Buck, and Buck didn’t know why.
